document_title: Gastric ulcer disease: Causes and symptoms
subsection_content:
Stomach ulcers can be caused by many different causes. Among them, the two most common causes are:
1. Helicobacter infection. pylori (HP bacteria)
HP bacteria are the leading cause of stomach ulcers
H.pylori infection is the leading cause of stomach ulcers. After entering the stomach, this bacteria will burrow into the mucous layer of the gastric mucosa, secreting toxins that damage the gastric mucosa, inhibiting the production of protective factors in the gastric mucosa, forming ulcers. ulcers. (first)
2. Long-term use of non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs (NSAIDs)
Using NSAIDs such as ibuprofen, naproxen, diclofenac... for a long time will damage the stomach. These drugs inhibit prostaglandin synthesis, reducing the effectiveness of gastric mucosa protection, making the stomach susceptible to ulcers.
Besides the above two causes, the disease can also be caused by less common causes, including:
Increased stomach acid secretion: This can happen for many reasons, including genetics, smoking, stress or consuming certain foods. Zollinger-Ellison syndrome: This is a rare condition that causes excess acid in the stomach.; Increased stomach acid secretion: This can happen for many reasons, including genetics, smoking, stress or consuming certain foods.; Zollinger-Ellison syndrome: This is a rare condition that causes excess acid in the stomach.
